iNht8eWWBG_pdy_MtY9czQ.text: We were looking for top-notch coffee in Pittsburgh, and this is my wife and I's favorite coffee, even though it is advertised as a Kitchen.  Excellent Americano's made with coffee from Counter Culture roasters.

uTPJivC-7VZ32CdiRCaNIA.text: I am so glad this place is in Pittsburgh! If you work downtown, you know that there aren't many lunch options. Sure, you can walk to Market Square and sit down somewhere, but if you're short on time, your options are pretty limited to run-of-the-mill chain-type places. Bluebird is such a breath of fresh air!  From the signage to the decor, it is warm and inviting. And though the interior is on the small side, there's plenty of room to wait inside for when the weather is bad. They change the menu often depending on what is in season, especially the desserts.  I had been meaning to try this place for a long time now because my work friends rave about it, but because I often bring my lunch, I didn't get a chance to go until last week. Because we were having a pizza party at work, I decided to get a few sides and a dessert to the go with the pizza. It was a Friday after all, so I had to go all out. I had the housemade chips and a side of brussels sprouts with pecans and bacon jam. The bacon jam (which is so overdone at times) was really the perfect complement to the brussels sprouts and I had no trouble eating the entire thing.  For dessert, I tried the panna cotta on recommendation from the work friend. It was an earl gray panna cotta on top of a small piece of poppyseed cake. It was absolutely delicious. The textures of the panna cotta and cake blended together perfectly. There were so many sides and bakery items I wanted to try, and of course I need to come back for a real lunch sometime, not just sides and desserts. Everything looked and smelled incredibly fresh, and there are so many healthy choices as well. This is truly food you can feel good about.

vC5aLkR9SRu0XepZeOHcLw.text: Solid spot for an on-the-go lunch. Everything is made fresh and on site. Would have given more stars if they replenished the soup that we wanted, and had room to dine in.

vm3pfKAc4ne-MwDG_dTPRg.text: Came here for the breakfast sandwiches and we were not disappointed. I had the fried egg sandwich on the pretzel bun and the hubster had the fried egg sandwich with bacon on ciabatta roll.  OMG!  For a breakfast sandwich they are HUGE! We ended up splitting the pretzel bun sandwich and saved the ciabatta roll for the flight back to Sacramento (low cost airlines = little bags of peanuts and pretzels).  Bread on both sandwiches was excellent.  Nicely layered with fresh produce and choice of swiss or cheddar cheese - yum!!!  We also got a cashew scone and chocolate chip muffin for later which were also delightful.

obHl3YFtHD7AVRCtHJmBBg.text: Ive been to this bakery/ restaurant about 30 times. I love the concept of a French bakery.The quiche and croissants are five stars.Anything I ate was five stars. So if you're hungry I suggest the Quiche or another daily special. One friend likes the grits. On a lighter appetite, the croissant or an amazing muffin.   The coffee.....well, I am not happy with the flavor. Too bitter. I enjoy espresso,cappuccino, drip coffees, and usually the strong flavors. I have tried their cappuccino, americano, drip and decaf cappuccino,drip and pour overs. Nothing makes me warm and fuzzy. Granted, I am a coffee snob, so take my judgement with a grain of salt. Please try this wonderful place!

1xVKNoJgEDzK0BI6L6uPIg.text: BEST biscuits and gravy I've ever had!!  Also had coffee and quiche, both delicious. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you're visiting the area and looking for a quick breakfast/brunch, I highly recommend trying this place out. You won't be disappointed!

Udt5u889YtnQHlI53LbVBg.text: I work downtown and stop in at bluebird from time to time.  We've even ordered catering a few times.  Food is great and my favorite is the oatmeal for breakfast.  It's the best oatmeal I've ever had.   Sandwiches for lunch meeting are really great but I get the feeling that catering either isn't their favorite thing to do or they just don't do it enough to perfect the art.   Almost every time we order, something is missing but overall they take care of the issue and we are still happy customers.   If the food wasn't so amazing I'd never go there because their customer service is lacking.  In my personal experience I've never run into anyone on staff there who didn't think that it was my pleasure to enter into the establishment.   LOL if they fix their customer service attitudes this place would earn a fourth star from me.

oP1C3SEtx4FveXbxtHbRSw.text: I have eaten here a few times this week.  The breakfast is fantastic.  I just had the frittata.  It was amazing.    This is a great restaurant and I am glad it is in Pittsburgh.

h4D1qXA4y-UlEv5SK6rkYA.text: I will preface this review by saying that Bluebird's food is more than just a-ok.  The breakfast pastries are deliciously gluttonous. The lunches are fresh and unique. Seriously, try the turkey-gouda sandwich. Yum.   I also appreciate that the Bluebird Kitchen works around seasonal local ingredients.  Blueberry season? Expect to see it in muffins, macaroons, and even the soups! This is fantastic.  My problem has nothing to do with the food quality itself.   For several reasons, I think every item on the menu is overpriced by about a dollar.   First, the portions are small. The sandwiches, though delicious, are about the size of the lunches you would make at home with wonderbread and deli turkey.   Second, sides are not included.  If you do want a side, it will cost you at least 3 dollars. Not worth it for a side!   Last, some of the people who work there are downright unfriendly.  Once, I queried a rather listless female about the blackberry macaroons.  I had purchased Bluebird's scrumptious macaroons before, but the ones I saw behind the glass this time were "mini."  So when crankypants tells me off the top of her head that they were about the same price as the normal sized pastries, I was taken aback.  When I asked her if she was sure about the cost, she rolled her eyes and gave me sass. Come on. It was a just question!   Like I said, I am overall impressed with the superb quality of the food.  But both the service and quantity are lacking...

wH2EQOx_msxzXJg19Fd2-Q.text: I am a fan of Bluebird's food, however, don't anticipate a large portion. If you're leaving feeling stuffed than your wallet will be feeling slim.   At times their kitchen can get easily backed up. I would suggest if you have a limited time for lunch that you may want to skip visiting Bluebird. If you can order ahead or if they offer delivery you may want to consider that route.   If it is winter time when you visit, you may want to be keep your coat on. The frequent opening of the door tends to keep the entire place on the colder side. Opening doors though are a great sign of a business doing well though so this is hardly a criticism of the establishment.

fJgnhfV9gOoiaS2ip-jF6A.text: We went here for breakfast and ordered the pastrami salmon on a bagel and egg sandwich on a pretzel bun. We also split a side of sweet potato corned beef hash, which was amazing!   The sandwiches were tasty and a nice size. We would have preferred that they offered to toast the bagel. Nice place to stop in for a quick bite in downtown pgh.

JwcD-TS44yBsbM3icykaWg.text: I like it.  Lots of good sounding things on the menu.  I had coffee and almond bread pudding.  Both were good although the coffee was almost boiling, could have been a bit cooler.  My co-workers got espresso that looked pretty damn good and also had fresh squeezed orange juice.  The girls that were working there were very pleasant.  There is not much seating inside but they do have a counter that is facing the outside window.  I love it when cafes do this.  You get to watch everyone walking by outside and with the location of this place (right outside Market Square) you surely get to see a lot of people.

Fwe3-8EhbZx-bP9LF4CRtg.text: I have had to downgrade my rating after numerous trips there. Today was the straw that broke this camel's back. I was there before the lunch rush. There was one other customer, she was being helped.  The three other employees ignored me for a good two minutes.  One was absentmindedly playing with her phone.  I ordered the chicken vegetable faro soup and a vegan chocolate chip cookie.  The service is just so hipster, I'm-too-cool-to-work vibe that I honestly can't take it anymore.  Every transaction with every employees is just cold and unfriendly, but yet I still feel guilted to write in a tip on the tip line.  Got back to my office to eat my soup, and it was nearly all watery broth.  What a kick in the teeth.  At least my cookie was good...

axiYubERV3hDYQHeGpQ5Dg.text: A coworker and I walked a few blocks to the Bluebird Kitchen since we had heard that this was the bee's knees.    It was lunch time and not too crowded yet so we ordered, paid and waited for about 10 minutes for our cubans.  We both thought that the $9 for the sandwich ($11+ with a side) was a little pricey for the small 5-6" sandwich.    We walked back to the office to eat and we both agreed that the bread was VERY  TOUGH!!! and we both felt like we needed dental work afterwards.  We agreed that for the price, the bread could have been softer and there should have been more ingredients.  The 2 local sub shops put in more ingredients than what was in these sandwiches for much less.     Service with a smile:  5 stars Cuban sandwich:  2 stars

e-r2iB3_L9UuC5lgWxOkYA.text: Highly over rated. The fried egg sandwich was okay at best. The pretzel bun was flavorless and the combo of egg with lettuce and tomato did not work well together.

CFcfZuyBccByIhBZIS7rqQ.text: I ordered the house turkey sandwich for lunch.. I unfortunately have to say I was underwhelmed. It was certainly a fresh sandwich but the main reason I got it was because the shallot bacon jam sounded really good, except they barely put any on. I'm talking I couldn't even see it at first so I actually went into the work kitchen for some dressing and upon further inspection found the slightest smear of jam under a part of the cheese. The sandwich was quite dry and bland so for $9.90 I'm definitely disappointed. I will say their staff was really friendly and their baked goods looked amazing. I'll definitely try this place again for breakfast but I don't think I'll pay for lunch here again.

56eKCCN18imfPl0lvknKEQ.text: Service was friendly and fast. Only tried the biscuits and gravy this time. The biscuit was definitely homemade, very light and fluffy. Sausage gravy had a decent amount of sausage and was not salty like most sausage gravy a can be. I will definitely be checking out more of their menu in the next few months!

qHS0P9lcX4IFp3KGQh0Wlw.text: $9.00 for canned tuna excuse me tuna nicoise is just not going to work for me. Not in this universe nor any other for that matter.   The Bluebird Kitchen has hours until 3pm.  I arrived at 2:50pm and not wanting anyone to have to prepare something that close to closing time I opted from the tuna nicoise salad with the mustard dressing. Now hear me out on this one. When the dressing is the best part of the meal you know you're in trouble.    The description of the salad said, "Yellow fin tuna cured in oil. Oh come off if BBK, yellow fin, and cured ought to be removed out of that description. I feel smoke going up my breaches and I don't like it.  I do not like far reaching menu descriptions and inflated prices for a tuna salad.  I had to grab a  copy of the menu after I started eating.  I had to reread the meal description to double check what I had gotten myself into.  I don't care what kind of tuna you started out with. Once it goes in the can it all becomes the same tuna when you take it out of there.  The space is very lovely, big windows and bright , airy and sunny.  I would love to go back for a cup of coffee....but I'll get my tuna salad elsewhere for now.   Switch to tuna steaks, add another $1.50 to the price of the salad either that or take $4.00 of the price of the salad and let it be what it is.

HI9l5UTGywi80mbjT89frw.text: This place used to be acceptable when Pittsburgh didn't have many other options for quick and healthy dining. However, for the last few years they have been resting on their laurels without taking new competition and consumer awareness into account. It's 2017, you can't put a revolting, rock-hard avocado on a $9 salad anymore and expect repeat customers. I also find many of their lunch options to be poorly-conceived, and their soups and sauces are usually either under-seasoned or overly sweet. Not worth it for the price.

U3VQ6ruN_LhcU-8zb9e0CA.text: Not the best service...food was disappointing...we went there on a recommendation we were in town from California. .I don't particularly recommend going there for breakfast. Can't speak about lunch.

svUeTYxthXO9uV6ydRpBgg.text: A great local healthy option!  Stopped I here with a coworker and I was impressed. They have healthy soups, salads, sandwiches, and sides. Lots of vegetarian options as well as GF. Their desert selection also looked amazing and were hard to resist. It is counter service and the lettuce type salads were pre-made but looked very fresh. Their sides and soups change and they have specials.   I had a small watermelon/kale/quinoa salad and a large corn chowder soup. The salad was light, flavorful, and refreshing. The corn chowder was just amazingly packed full of corn and other vegetables. It was hardy and delicious. I was full but couldn't stop eating it.   I also got a peanut butter bacon cookie... Yes PB & bacon... omg... So much for watching calories but it was worth it. The cookie was moist and scrumptious.  I will definitely be back!

lKwFoRMj_vuDp1HwYSXGDg.text: Menu selections were decent.  I was able to get a chicken salad that I like.  However, it didn't appear to have a lot of chicken.  Especially with the price being a little high.   The lighting was a little dark, which made it hard to real menu that is written on a large chalk board.  But it was very clean and the stuff were all very helpful and accommodating for my order.    I will try this place again.

OoRZb5tvlduNc6076ny3Lw.text: Cute little coffee shop and cafe. My vanilla cappuccino was delicious. House roasted turkey sandwich was phenomenal! Service was great too

M35TVqdwQn2hLkdIR_yXqA.text: Their baked goods are delicious I'll give them that. Beyond that their Foods okay I'm a former chef and my tastes and standards are high. The owner is a bit graphing rude and do not really care for him and his sensibilities. I can create a lot tuna environment when you're putting out a certain energy. If I want a cup of coffee I'll go to the 7-Eleven that's about how high they rank with me. If you want the sandwich who's playing at other places like your house

VBzzQ2TnWgRaQARpUw_JFQ.text: I dream about their biscuits and gravy. So good! Their cinnamon buns are also amazing. I've only ever ordered takeout from here and it tastes just as good as I would imagine it would if you had eaten in the restaurant.  My only complaint is that they aren't open on the weekends!!

vtkSK721LInBqzmNMdw52Q.text: To all my GF friends out there, this is for you:  I stop into Bluebird once or twice a month. My go-to is usually their pre-made salad with tuna, oven dried tomato, tomato, haricot vert, hard boiled egg, olives, avocado, and mustard vinaigrette. Delicious, filling and worth the $9. I have tried select GF options from their fresh food bar but unfortunately, their portion sizes for the price are VERY poor. However, I can't knock down their rating to 3 stars for that. They make up for it with their GF dessert options. The peanut butter bacon cookie= HOLY DELICIOUS! Sometimes, they offer it as a cookie sandwich with a sweet cream filling. I treat myself to this mouth watering creation a few times a year. If I could get away with it, I'd have one everyday! There are other GF desserts and from what I've tried, they are worth every penny.  Now that I've read the reviews of their lattes, I will have to pair one with my favorite cookie next time I treat myself!

sNeD8MSkZV_4Cf8xE4Qslg.text: Spending a lot of time in Pittsburgh and had become convinced that lunch was going to be protein bars only. Until we found Bluebird. Great soups, fresh salads, a lot of vegetarian options that aren't available anywhere else in town. Plus the service is awesome and the staff is just adorable. Pretty much my only choice in downtown now.

KCmlUM6WFOzDme9edtqxpA.text: I am SO in love with myself for discovering the Bluebird Kitchen today.   I mean, I have found a shining oasis in the midst of chain restaurant mediocrity.  Well, before I get too self-congratulatory, I should first admit that today when my co-workers and I went to Market Square to get lunch, I declared that I was going to hit Chipotle.  I may be a snob when it comes to restaurants, but I can appreciate a good chain establishment when I see it, and that one makes my short list.  However, when I walked through the door and came to the horrifying realization that the line was, oh, 4 miles long, I walked right back out with a "Nope. Nope. Nope. Nope."  Not worth it.  But, now what?  Every place was crazy busy.  Then, as though my feet were being guided by a higher power, I kept walking away from Market Square towards Wood St., and that's when I saw it: a little, unassuming sign saying "Bluebird Kitchen".  And then I knew.  This was The One.  I walked inside, and my little hipster heart lept with joy as I beheld the giant chalk menus, retro-ish tile floor, window-seating counters, tureens of soups, bowls of fresh side salads, and plates upon plates of lovingly prepared assorted cookies.  There were only a handful of other patrons inside, but I knew the tidal wave was coming and I had to act fast as more people steadily walked through the door after me.  I made a quick pass down the line to look at all the food and hemmed and hawed over whether to get a Cuban, Turkey, or the monthly vegetarian sandwich for but a moment before deciding not to over-think and ordering the turkey sandwich, a side of the sweet potato salad, and a lemon crinkle cookie.    Turkey sandwich - excellent quality bread, right amount of meat, and toppings made it all very moist Sweet potato salad - Delightful.  Sweet potatoes were soft, and the crunchy almonds and pears set it off nicely Lemon cookie - Perfection.  Soft, pillowy, buttery, sweet but not *too* sweet.  The only thing that took away from this meal was my fault, and it was that between the sandwich bread, the potato salad, and the cookie, it was a very sweet meal.  I should have ordered something salty like a soup or chips instead of the potato salad to balance out the flavor.  But that's okay; now that I know this place exists and I grabbed a menu, I'll be better prepared for next time.

VHGT9JdlnRllnyJSmqZEsA.text: I came here for breakfast before a conference, I was excited to try some local breakfast places. I think the highlight of my breakfast was the freshly squeezed orange juice: it was very sweet, natural, and definitely the champion of the day.   I ordered the local fresh eggs on ciabatta with the house made sausage.  I would have given a four if the bread had been toasted,  but it wasnt. The sausage had good flavor, but I would have liked a little salt on my eggs. All in all a good breakfast. If I am back in town I would try the pastries, they looked and smelled amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local fresh eggs on ciabatta bread.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Freshly made orange juice, squeezed right in front of you for freshness!

g_VTvsh9oXAmyxp-BpqkWQ.text: In Pit for a business trip, I saw the great reviews on Bluebird. Walked a half mile in 40 degree weather to get a good lunch. Ordered soup & the quiche, which took time to warm up. As I stood in the corner, the overly-perky blonde with the fake plastered smile told me twice she wanted to use the previously unused register; the second warning intended for me to move when I did not block the paying customer. In a small restaurant when all the seating was taken, there is nowhere to stand, except in front of the door or in line to order. I could see her walk over to another employee, who watched me as the fake, spiky blonde bad mouthed me for not moving.  Regardless of whether the food is good, employees bad-mouthing customers while at the counter turned the choice of this restaurant sour. The customers deserve better treatment than this. My apologies to the owner, but the experience made me regret I went to Bluebird today.

VO6nClLlgwi117LnQhpfdA.text: Very impressed! I feel like I'm a pretty tough judge on deli/sandwich shops.  I think it's really easy to make a boring sandwich, salad or side.  They can just end up being bland and not creative at all.  That is NOT the case with this place (look at my rhyming!).    First thing's first.  Everything on the menu looked awesome!  From the sammies to the salads to the sides, it was really hard to decide.  I'm a sucker for roast beef and horsy dressing, so I went with the Roast Beef sandwich.  It definitely held it's own with a nice amount of meat, lettuce, tomato and horsy dressing (I love me some sauce!) on a delish ciabatta bread.    I also sampled the bean salad and pasta salad.  I LOVED the bean salad!  It was super tasty and had great flavor.  The pasta salad was bland.  I wouldn't get that again.  Only loser in the meal though... so I still left a very happy lady.  The bakery part of the deli looked incredible!  I could have gobbled it all up.  I, of course, had to get something!  So I tried the homemade s'more.  It was ooey gooey goodness!  I had my eye on a couple other items I'll certainly be back for, promise!  Although the line was long, it moved along fast and was able to zip in and out in no time.  This is such a great spot for a quick lunch, if I worked downtown I might be tempted to go in every day!  Another new establishment we're lucky to have in the Burgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZBL6c1M0-HqbnAeoCJyFww.text: I would only recommend this spot for their pastries & breakfast - both of which are super tasty. Skip their coffee and their lunch. Annoyingly, they have delicious coffee, but they are cheap on their to-go cups so most of it ends up on your hands, clothes and the street (I've experienced this repeatedly over the past couple of months). But the real killer here was that my salad was filled to the brim with unwashed lettuce (nice and gritty, yum!) and only about 2 ounces of chicken. What justification can I provide for spending $15+ on lunch when they can't even bother to wash lettuce? Maybe it was an off day but lettuce costs $1/head and skimping on toppings to save money is just not acceptable at that price point. So if you are going to go here, skip lunch and coffee and just go for the pastries & breakfast.

Ewe2hlMTFaVm_MZ5ESLGlA.text: I keep coming back here because the items are attractive, ingenious, and the staff is amazing- it is rare that, especially in a large city, I return to places with inconsistent marks, but damn, that was a fine cake. And it has only been finer.   Since my last visit, I have swooned over Bluebird's delicious Instagram and have eagerly come back for their chocolate peanut butter cake, sage and brown butter nectarine, and nearly French, perfect macarons. I'm still iffy on their savory items, but await tomorrow's breakfast sandwich with gusto. When all is said and done, I think this is an awfully special bakery.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cinnamon toast macaron. Hot DAMN. I am leaving for a 600mi. road trip this weekend and might need to pack these for the drive.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Peanut butter crunch layer cake!
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sage, brown butter, pastry cream, and nectarine jam cake.

9ny_EANXAWwiIpHx0Go88A.text: Went here on a whim for breakfast and it was amazing! Fried Eggs sandwich with cheese on pretzel bread was phenomenal! Coffee is decently strong too. It was so good I went back the very next day with a friend and had the salmon and cucumber sandwich.   If you have a little extra time in your morning visit your local downtown pittsburgh coffee shop its worth the adventure! My only quip is that it probably took around 10 minutes for them to make my sandwich when nobody was in the shop. Kind of dissapointing considering they have like 3 or 4 people in the kitchen and all i wanted was eggs.   I will be returning soon to try their lunch menu. Im sure I wont be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Croque monsieur
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frattata

0k2No98wnsXLwi9ckqZqSw.text: Ordered: Bluebird granola, House roast beef, and macchiato. Everything was delicious, a bit expensive for the granola ($6) but everything did taste great.  House Roast Beef was nice and crunchy on the outside.

QXpnt3OdyV5WIP3yGt5U_Q.text: When Bluebird Kitchen opened I was so excited and not let down at all. The menu items are always fresh and up to par. The House Roast Beef and House Turkey sandwiches are my typical orders and they live up to what a sandwich should be. Last night at a Yelp event I was able to sample Bluebird catering items for the first time. The asparagus wrapped in phyllo dough is so good. Well done, gang!

yh-7VL5fBaUG-TmQPKZeVw.text: We were in town for a visit and stopped by for breakfast. I guess we went too late because the first three things we tried to order were not available. I ended up getting the oatmeal. It was good but nothing spectacular. The dirty chai latte was really good, though. I have a feeling this review would be more positive if the other dishes had been available. If we go to the downtown area again we'll probably give it another try earlier than 10 am.

UCPl9sXv4_B7vCGvf0SkWw.text: I finally stopped in for lunch after following Bluebird Kitchen on Instagram for while lusting after their unique baked goods.   I came in around 11am to beat the rush (a line had formed by noon) and was greeted with very friendly service. Having not been there before, I didn't realize you placed your order at the beginning of the counter, and then made your way down to the register. I ordered at the register unknowingly  and they kindly took my order there instead.   I had a Cuban, which was warm and toasty and delicious. The pickles and mustard added the perfect tangy flavor to the sandwich. My only complaint is that the piece pork belly on my sandwich was a little fatty, but this was not a problem as I picked it off and ate the good parts as the sandwich was still loaded with ham. Overall, it was a very satisfying lunch.   I ended up going back up after my sandwich to order an oatmeal sandwich cookie- which was huge and delicious- the filling wasn't too sweet.   This place is a little on the pricier side, but completely worth it in my opinion for the noticeably quality ingredients, attentive service, and fresh bright atmosphere that makes for a relaxing lunch break. I will definitely be stopping in again to try the delicious sounding soups and more baked goods!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oatmeal sandwich cookie- two big cookies and the filling wasn&#39;t overly sweet
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cuban sandwich with pork belly and ham

WW_n_igNTTWsWMzi1ZVM8g.text: A litte bit on the pricey side at first glance, however the Cuban sandwich was worth it. The meat was tender and the whole grain mustard gave the sandwich a different kick from your typical cuban sandwich.   Red velvet cookie sandwich was also delicious and fresh.   Be prepared to wait in a little bit of a line around lunch time though and seating is sparse. Good for carry out if you have the time to spare during your lunch break.

j18VEJmzJtzpeqwsm8tMzg.text: I have gone here once before but did not feel particularly motivated to review it. I had the croque monsieur and it was tasty but I think I may have built the Bluebird Kitchen up in my mind that the sandwich just could not live up to the level I wanted it to be at.   However today I went with one of my coworkers back to the Bluebird Kitchen and it I don't think either one of us could wait to review the sandwiches we had. I chose the Cuban sandwich because it is pretty much impossible for me to not eat one when it is an option. This Cuban sandwich was everything a lunch fantasy could be. Packed in between a buttery ciabatta roll, was layers of rosemary ham, pork belly, Swiss cheese, pickles and whole grain mustard. I eat quite a few Cuban sandwiches and this one has surpassed a good majority of any of the ones I have had in the past.   They also have delicious looking cakes and cookies. But I was too overwhelmed by the amount of pig I had committed to eating that I didn't think it was wise to add a macaron the size of my head on top of it. There are also daily specials which include a lot fresh soups and salad.

1wDf6K1i5sevXVC5YtH_gQ.text: This is a lovely and charming place in the middle of downtown Pittsburgh, but it was simply just okay. I went for breakfast with my mom and got the pastrami cured salmon bagel and she got the sweet potato corned beef hash. We also ordered a pumpkin cinnamon roll to go (I can't resist anything pumpkin). The interior was beautiful, the food looked great, but upon eating it I just kind of felt alright. It wasn't too special except everything just looked good. I'm willing to give it another try for lunch because it's never easy to get breakfast perfectly right!

lioyDXcxhHMf0vEI6uWzkg.text: Finally had the chance to go here after watching it being constructed for what seemed like a decade. Had the fried egg sandwich with bacon, and it was really good. The quality of their ingredients is obvious, as the bacon was thick and flavorful, the eggs were delicious, and the bread was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.  This restaurant is a refreshing change of pace from some of the other options around downtown, and will hopefully be here to stay. Can't wait to go back and try some lunch sometime.

lsGJTRGysypq7FnUGQCCmg.text: The sandwich I had was good, but essentially a half of a sandwich for $9!  It came with nothing else, so if I would have ordered a drink and a bag of chips I would probably be in the 12-15 range!  Way overpriced for me.

iMqhEm8wm4zKYn-bNVoxFw.text: Great food but on the pricy side. Not a chain so that is a plus. Best takeaway food in market square. Recommended if u are looking for more upscale lunch to go.

FWtyuwMJVHA5vYosUgs5ow.text: BEETS.  Give me all the fresh roasted beets.   I've been saying for some time now that I wish there was something East End Food Coop-y downtown for lunch and Bluebird kitchen is kind of that.  They are so effing good for lunch that if it's nice out I pretty much have to abandon my salad from home in the office fridge and hit this place up.  Lots of delicious and healthful vegetable dishes and soups that you can get as sides or full meals, or go  with one of their sinful sandwiches and desserts .  I haven't had anything from here that I haven't loved.  The main issues are that the line is usually out of control when I want to go, sometimes the staff takes out their obvious stress from said line on the wrong customer (any customer) and it has to be nice out for me because there's never room to eat inside and it's nice to eat outside in Market Square.  But that long line has got to be good news for them and I want more options like this downtown, so cheers.

FOhw5MIGDItHZGINlja2Dw.text: I was in town on business and wanted a nice lunch for one while avoiding a chain restaurant.  I stopped in after 1:30pm (no waiting) and had a great turkey sandwich, tomato soup, and one amazing biscuit.  Not sure how long they have been in business, but would love to see one of these in Chicago.  They ran out of decaf coffee, but gave me a soda  water for free.  Nice decor too.

TaO9isth0AkHdpgYpvWt4Q.text: I have not one complaint about Bluebird Kitchen. They are quick, attentive, thorough and nice. Not to mention their sandwiches are sensational and very upscale for a Pixburgh sandwich that typically contains french fries. A little taste of France in the Pitts sounds like a fabulous way to spend my lunch hour!

M9NVMmQlZi_yNJLdS22Pmg.text: This is a good lunch spot in Market Square and a solid four stars. Keep in mind that they do close at 3. I went in with coworkers around 12:30. There were a few people in line and we had to wait a few minutes for food but it overall moved fast.  I had the turkey sandwich that has avocado and jam on it. My coworkers had the roast beef (cold) and the Cuban (hot). We all enjoyed our sandwiches. My only complaint is that the bread was a bit too think for the sandwich. Some people might enjoy this but it was too much bread for me. Nonetheless, it was tasty.  Service was fast and friendly and the prices seemed on par with the area. We didn't get to have dessert or coffee so we'll have to go again to try that.

ViJtz8ItTyAU9MxR13r-hg.text: Great food but a lack in attention to detail. I usually get the vegan option for lunch. I am unsure I will be back. Their last vegan sandwich had Kalamata olives on it, which are great on a sandwich once you remove the pits. I almost broke my tooth. Thinking it's an easy mistake to miss one I continued to eat my sandwich. Every olive on the sandwich still had its pit. When I called to inform them they did not seem too concerned. So enjoy with cation.

4-gzFGRqW9IIOuL-2K9pIQ.text: "Discovered" Blue Bird Kitchen via Instagram while visiting Pittsburgh for the week. I normally don't do repeats when traveling, especially in Pittsburgh where I have many favorites. I made an exception this time however! I stopped in twice for lunch this week, and was very pleased both times.   Somehow I managed to hit the line perfectly on both visits, but the line is a good indicator of how delicious the food is here! The first visit I got a roast beef sandwich, on nicely chewy ciabatta. I took it down to nearby Market Square and enjoyed it while listing to some great live music.   My second visit, I tried the Cuban and a cinnamon brown sugar macaron--flavor explosion! I removed one extra fatty piece of pork from my sandwich, but that's a personal preference/texture issue with me. The macaron was perfect!  With tip, my lunch was less than $15 both visits, which was awesome! They also had a limited dining area, which I took advantage of today, since there was a busy farmers market going on at Market Square.   My next trip to Pittsburgh I want to try their quiche, it looked really good, as did their layer cake of the day. I will also pack more stretchy pants, because I think I gained 5 pounds this week, eating my way through the 'burgh!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One of the best macarons I&#39;ve ever had - strawberry and peach
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. July vegetarian sandwich - sooo good!

qTeHj-vZBeDcybDRD1nulA.text: I have been hearing great things about Bluebird Kitchen, so I was very pleased to find out it could live up to the hype.  All the food was freshly and creatively prepared.  I tried the Cuban plus a Hazelnut Oatmeal cookie, and both were really tasty.    I don't get Downtown much during the day, however it's good to know there is a really good option for lunch and breakfast.    I was also surprised to find out there are 2 locations, the second location is on Smithfield.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZIcg0pA6l5ia-uhtxYnh0g.text: Went here for breakfast with a co-worker while we were at a conference.  I was not sure if it was because I was hungry or it it was really that good. I had the breakfast egg sandwich on a chibatta roll with the additional sausage. To say it was delicious and that it hit the spot is an understatement. Something to be said when a friend egg is cooked just right, so the yolk runs, but not that much.  The sandwich also came with lettuce and tomato with Swiss and cheddar. Yum! So we we decided to go back the next day and don't you know, it was good on that day too. So this is a definite have to visit location. It is my understanding that they have a sister store not to far away as well. Haven't been to that one, but I have to recommend this on not only for the food but for the friendly service that we got.  They also have a special on day old pastry, I had a mixed berries and perch bread pudding that was on point. Great job all around.

Dcg-x2_ElStey0KIaOPtIw.text: came here for breakfast by recommendation of the night manager of the Omni William-Penn hotel.   quaint space with high ceilings, bright feel and light seating.   menu was small, but with good selections. the steel cut oats were warming and home-y with the twist of a coconut milk base. when the girl was serving it to me though, a dollop of oats landed on her finger and she scraped it back into the oats container - grossed me out a little.   hubby ordered the egg sandwich. overall, a fine sandwich with the highlight being the bread.   as we leave the best we can say is "it's okay". average breakfast menu that you can get anywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. egg sandwich
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

w1_5T5S49B0-FXKue1W9Hg.text: I came here after too many long waits trying to get breakfast at the Hilton Garden across the street. I wish I knew about this place sooner! It has fantastic food, fast fresh breakfasts and happy & helpful staff.

EJzYm60LsxUy4do3vzq5oA.text: Visiting from California - sitting here in Bluebird on cold, rainy Pittsburgh morning. Just finished the best oatmeal I've had in a long time. Husband had the frittata and it's delicious too. Small, comfy place where you order at the counter. This is our third time eating here. The breakfast sandwich is great as is their soup. Friendly staff - highly recommend.

1wg698OvKHDVJF4yYucbZw.text: LOVED this place!!! I had the tuna sandwich and the vegan chocolate chip cookie - I enjoyed my meal so much that I went back the next day and ordered the same items! Fabulous lunch options, I will definitely be back!

_u1g_cl3-Art19o_rvBu8Q.text: I only give it one star because there is no negative star rating.   Impossibly slow.  Apathetic staff.  .....Waiting for over ten minutes for a sandwich that never came while watching the kitchen and wait staff stand around gabbing....... Then, when I got back to my office to eat my beet salad, I found that the server had given me less than half of a serving.  Save yourself the time and aggravation and walk on by.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Bluebird Kitchen sold me a fraction of a beet salad at full price!

uZjuLfiRaphfTm82ehU_qg.text: I ordered a double espresso, as usual, and this time I received a single shot of espresso. I asked one of the workers about it, and she was very rude about it and refused to add another shot! I paid full price. The coffee was good, but I will NOT be returning for the rude service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sold me a double shot! THATS NOT A DOUBLE!!!

YzngWXDqb9jrAQtKCkeUrA.text: Today went here on a whim for lunch. The atmosphere is relaxed and modern. The staff is really friendly. I had the chicken and quoina soup, which I recommend their soup all fresh and homemade. Get their bread that they make. I also had the tuna sandwich. This place really love to add olives in their dishes. It was a little pricy but well worth it for the quality.

Pjy-P8e-4GUwr4-dDgoyKA.text: TLDR; great food. Bluebird Kitchen is really a takeout place, not a cafe.  Tried this place for a quick lunch with my spouse. The food was good as many other reviewers stated. Good variety of tasty artisanal bread, fresh ingredients, and nice, clever takes on the basic sandwiches. She ordered the Turkey, I the Roast Beef. We also got their in-the-restaurant made chips, which were great.   I rated it a little on the low side for me, as the food was slightly on the pricey side for what we got ($30 lunch for 2 for sandwiches, no refills on iced tea). And, we went expecting to eat in. However, it is definitely "Bluebird Kitchen" not "Bluebird Dining Room". I mean to say that the accommodations for dining in are not good at all, unless you want to sit alone and watch people walk by at the windows. There are three bar tables along the walls of the place, with backless steel 30" (think low bar) stools for seating. I imagine that most people will be getting food to go and eat at the tables on Market Square, but the weather was too cold for us.

aFyuOQR9Ud9bKLFczfjn5Q.text: Bluebird Kitchen reminds me of something you'd find in NYC. It's one of the fancier take-out places for breakfast and lunch here in downtown Pittsburgh. You can tell a lot of thought was put into building the menu because it's not your average sandwiches and salads; it seems slightly gourmet. I've tried a couple things here and they've all tasted well put-together and very fresh. On top of their regular menu items, they have a daily special along with changing salad options and not to mention their baked goods. The few downfalls to Bluebird Kitchen are the space is small with very minimal seating, the layout is slightly awkward, so if you're not familiar with the place, it's hard to figure out where to order vs. where to pay, and it's only open until 3pm Mon-Fri, which was a real bummer for me when I used to live downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roast beef sandwich
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Snow pea and quinoa salad

tHQphoYAmQsJvs2dpKfVxQ.text: I have never had a bad thing from Bluebird. The quality of the food is unmatched and worth paying for. The House Roasted Chicken salad is my favorite salad downtown and I always look forward to seeing what sides and pastries are being offered that day. They are also very accommodating and can customize your order depending on your dietary needs or specifications. Go to Bluebird! You won't regret it!

3Rgo8fMMNSyufqBDpMlLrw.text: I was very much looking forward to checking this place out for lunch.  I ordered the Pain Bagnat, Soup, Cookie, and a water for $17.00.  I was expecting it to live up to the price tag.  When I got back to my desk I discovered that I received some sort of chicken salad concoction instead and since I can't eat mayo it was a loss.    The soup was good for the first few spoons.  Then what was left looked like a gob of nasty so that, too, was a wash.  The cookie was good at least and water never disappoints.  Looks like I'll be hitting up the vending machine with what little cash I have left. Bummer.  Maybe I just caught them on an off day judging from all the good reviews.  Way too expensive for what you get regardless.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soup after a few spoons

BzTQeKZqreg7pETqRAOywQ.text: Bluebird Kitchen is tucked away in Market Square and easy to miss. It's a hidden gem, though and a great place for a healthy breakfast or lunch option in downtown. I love stopping by in the mornings for their granola and yogurt. In the afternoon, they have a great selection of fresh veggies, salads, and other lunch options - I love their fresh beets! If you're able to find a bar stool near the window, it's a prime spot for people watching, too! Tasty food to go, in downtown for a great price... that's a win for me!  - xoxo, A (A California girl living in Pittsburgh on purpose).

MyKGyjsgj6r0Bci0ww-dqQ.text: Thanks to various events that I have sampled Bluebird Kitchen at I could not wait to try out the real deal.  Glad I was able to beat the lunch crowd today as by the time I finished up my lunch (yes they have small counter tops with stools to sit at) the line was almost out the door.  They have a choice of fresh salads, sandwiches, sides and desserts which rotate daily.  I went with the turkey sandwich on homemade bread (the best bread I have tasted in a while that was thick and so fresh), lettuce, and a bacon jam with cheese.  I picked the potato salad as my side which had a nice mix of regular and sweet potatoes.  Got to sample the brussel sprout salad which was also tasty. Can't leave out dessert and went with the vegan chocolate chip cookie which melts in your mouth!  The only catch is the prices and those 3 things cost $15 but it was worth it.

UXcRmQnNNAnqs2anI6L1Pw.text: ***UPDATE*** After my last review, I got a message from Liz M., the owner of the Blue Bird, stating, "I hope you will give us a second chance to fill you up. I think a sandwich  just might do the trick...".  I feel that if an owner of a business bothers to reach out to me after a review, I owe it to that person to follow up. So today I stopped into the Blue Bird for lunch and ordered the Cuban sandwich.  Although it was pretty busy, the staff was very cheerful and courtious and I moved through the line rather quickly.  But after paying for my order, I waited for about 15 minutes to get my Cuban, which, in my opinion is a little longer than average for lunch. But like I said, it was busy and there were pleanty of orders to be filled before mine.  There's very limited seating at the Blue Bird so I took my sandwich back to my office which is only about a five minute walk. The sandwich held up well and was still warm when I unwrapped it. Paying $9.10 (tax included here) for a sandwich isn't what I'd call being thrifty but after one bite I could tell that this sandwich was worth every penny! The ciabatta was firm but not too hard. The pork belly and ham blended well with the pickle and mustard. The serving size was just perfect for a hearty appetite (I skipped dinner last night and only had a cup of coffee for breakfast today).  I'm upping the rating to four stars for a delicious sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cuban

OX4YWc1-wUtXrcPS4Wpobw.text: Came here twice in one week during a business trip. First stop was for a quick coffee and to grab a macaroon I'd seen on another review. The macaroon was so delicious (blueberry cheesecake flavor). Ambiance is cute too. The service was meh. Was not greeted, rather just stared at until I said hello and asked what I wanted to order.  Second stop was for a quick breakfast sandwich. Again yummy, but same kind of cold nonchalant service. I totally wanted to rate this place higher but service is kind of a big deal to me. At least the food is good.

yZgOwVIcfPldGQKgHy6arA.text: I'm in Pittsburgh for work and when I searched 'vegan' this came up with many reviews saying that there were a lot of vegan options so I decided to give it a try as it's right by the office building. - I went twice - once for breakfast and once for lunch.   Good points: almond milk available, labels for 'gf' and 'vegan', friendly staff, and AMAZING lattes   Not so good: The food - both times it just left me with a blah feeling - to be fair, for breakfast I just had the oatmeal, which was never going to be all that exciting - for lunch though I had the January sandwhich special which was chickpeas, lemon, carmelized pineapple, brussel sprouts, and pickled onion on sourdough - with all of that it should have been bursting with flavor but it litterally had no flavor at all - it just tasted like a ton of bread (which tasted more like french bread than sourdough to me) and smushed chickpeas  So honestly the 3 star rating is all for the latte

SPtl8n_UmgfVhjqOEbjI8Q.text: Local fried eggs with bacon on ciabatta was delicious. The yogurt parfait was fresh and good. Fresh squeezed orange juice and cinnamon roll were good too. Only complaint is that it took about 15 minutes and 2 reminders to get a simple bagel, which turned out to be burnt and bland afterall. Well worth the prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local fried eggs with bacon, yogurt parfait and fresh squeezed orange juice
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local fried eggs with bacon
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local fried eggs with bacon

EpLrCMZJ0ZbbGIJnwHlqWw.text: Woohoo - Breakfast redemption!  So my less than stellar reviews in the past had to do with my lunch experiences at Bluebird but this morning I went there for a breakfast sandwich and was not let down.    I had the fried egg sandwich on a pretzel roll with sausage.  It was hearty and delicious which is exactly what I needed.  It was freshly made as you can tell with the eggs - the eggs weren't industrially processed to look like a white and yellow cookie.  No, these were real eggs cracked open on a skillet and put into a sandwich.  There were tomato slices and greens.  I think the pretzel roll was a good option as the salt on the bun offered a little something to the unseasoned eggs.  The sausage was a nice complement as well to the sandwich.  They had some amazing looking pastries but I resisted.    I guess I know when I'll be heading over to Bluebird - the early morning when the birds are chirping!    I appreciate the owner reaching out to acknowledge my less than stellar reviews.  I'm glad that I got to give it another chance.

-qYUV0LAcxP2FA6yOuPiXA.text: Sometimes OK, but today I had the worst New England Clam Chowder of my life.  Gritty clams, appears to not be cream based(a defining characteristic of NE clam chowder), undersalted, and utterly tasteless.  I usually find this place to be underwhelming and overpriced but I keep giving it another shot for some reason.  Probably that awesome Cubano they make.  I should just stick to that.

9SiqU1ZoMANt3I94bOccKQ.text: Bluebird sets the bar high for deli restaurants in downtown Pittsburgh. The quality of sandwich breads and spreads is top notch. Roast beef, turkey, and vegetarian options are worth trying out. Kettle chips are average, but the fresh cookies are incredible!

uSpCjZMb1qHpv1NBEz3bvA.text: I had such high hopes for this place. I Arrived at 10:40 am and was told it is between lunch and breakfast therefore only the pastries and drinks are available. Breakfast service had just stopped and lunch would start at 11. Oh well, I said and ordered a cappucino. It's the sloppiest cappuccino I've ever been served. Maybe they're just new? I asked them how long they'd been open-- 3 years. I won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Probably the sloppiest looking cappuccino that I&#39;ve ever been served.

LjKCrgL0KFWlW0TkJOJtWw.text: I don't know if anyone has been to the new Market Square restaurant named Bluebird Kitchen, but it is a lovely addition to Market Square.  Previously, if you wanted something other than a donut, bagel or Egg McMuffin, you were pretty hard pressed to find something else.  However, with the opening of the Bluebird Kitchen you will be able to find much more than those breakfast staples.     Recently, I had the opportunity to indulge my southern hankerings for an old fashioned breakfast of grits and eggs.  Boy oh boy, were they delicious!  The stone ground grits were creamy and had flecks of cheddar cheese mixed into the grits along with little nuggets of bacon.  Topped by sunny-side up eggs, this was a breakfast took me back to Columbia, SC where my mother was born.  On another visit, the pastrami cured salmon on a toasted bagel made me believe that beef pastrami may be eliminated as my favorite type of pastrami.  With the addition of cucumber and oven dried tomato, this let me know that this restaurant gets all of the little details right.  You also want to try this restaurant for lunch where the house roast turkey sandwich with bacon jam, that's right bacon jam, is smack your mama good!

FLjV7LTHW1xGv3yPOzs9Gw.text: Today was my first time at BbK. I went there on my lunch break and there was a short line. I'd say in and out took me about 20 minutes to order, pay, and get my lunch. Not bad at all because everything is made fresh and the service is great.   I ordered the chicken salad sandwich which might be the best I've ever had. It had apples, chick peas, and I'm pretty sure some cumin with fresh chicken and a light mayo dressing, all on a croissant. I also got a side of chips which definitely taste fresh and homemade.   I grabbed an oatmeal cookie with chocolate buttercream icing for later, but I'm just going to go ahead and assume that it is also delicious. The prices are reasonable, too.   Definitely going back!

iUv2qNFJIasIPq4HFw5WpA.text: Bluebird Kitchen for breakfast is like the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.. Its just meant to be. Its one of the [few] perks of having to be at work at 5am. $6 for a single sandwich is a little pricey, I'll admit, but when you're indulging on what may be the most amazingly delicious part of your day, you forget all about that 6 bucks. I haven't been quite as impressed with lunch at bluebird (ergo the 4 stars instead of 5), but that's neither here nor there- let's get back to breakfast. If you happen to be downtown during breakfast, do yourself a favor and have some bluebird for breakfast, you will not be left disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Local fried egg sandwich

MmnQF0XuKbh2qQl6ocLJ2Q.text: When traveling the world it's sometimes tough to find a quick stop to find vegan food to fuel you up. This is certainly the place to do it. Further if you have travel companions they can find many options that are non-vegan. Glad I found this local favorite on my visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ER0iXHe1eR5_TuH6jv-Opg.text: We ordered Bluebird's breakfast catering for a 100-person small design conference we were planning. I wanted to make sure there was healthy, energizing food, and not just a stack of doughnuts to put everyone to sleep. Bluebird could not have delivered better. The greek yogurt with honey and granola was my favorite, but the pastries and fruit (berries, strawberries, pineapple) blew everyone away. It wasn't your typical fare and was clearly prepared with care. I seriously ate way too much yogurt. Highly recommended for a unique and healthy breakfast catering option.

XfLJo_0YmFfCMnjqtQNlJg.text: Bluebird Kitchen is simply not what it used to be. I haven't been here in five years, and I was pretty disappointed in my sandwich. I used to love the house turkey sandwich, which boasts house roasted turkey breast, butter lettuce, bacon jam, gouda cheese, and avocado. I was downtown this afternoon and decided to treat myself. I got back to my office that is now in Oakland, and I thought they'd messed up the order. I couldn't find the bacon jam or the avocado. I dug through and there was a stingy little swipe of each. So I got a turkey sandwich with lettuce and cheese on multigrain bread for $9.90. Maybe some things are the same as ever, but I'm never going to bother with this place again.

79bYWFfHcV8ScIocn63EXw.text: Let me just get this out of the way: Bluebird, when it's good, is REALLY good.  What sucks is, unlike my coworkers and everyone else here on Yelp, I have had more bad experiences with BBK than good.   The first time I went there, I was giddily excited to try their vegetarian sandwich-of-the-month. It was some kind of tofu on ciabatta, and the menu boasted that it had some kind of funky sauce and lots of delicious pickled vegetables.  What I got was a rock of bread with uncooked tofu and beets. Everything was served ice cold. It was gross.  I also tried another veg-o-the-month sandwich a couple of years later. This time it was fried eggplant and some other stuff. Same deal - ice cold, served on rock hard bread, and tasteless.  Then, one day recently, I happened upon this AMAZING potato kale and beet soup. It was one of the best soups I've ever had. I thought my luck with Bluebird was finally turning.  Since then, I have stalked BBK on social media and at the store, looking for another delicious, amazing, vegetarian soup. They never have it. They have no soup, or they only have meat soup.   Today, I went back to Bluebird to check on the soup situation. As I walked in the door, one of the counter workers stared at me with this look of disdain that can only be rivaled by my cat when I spray him with water. She stared, then went behind a pillar with another coworker while I looked at the soups. She came around the wall after a few seconds, and obnoxious giggling, to take my order. I got this miso egg drop soup that was marked gluten-free and dairy-free. I wondered if that meant it was also meat-free, but I didn't want to burden this poor girl with any more of my disgusting demands, so I left.   It had chicken it. I gave it to my coworker, who said it was delicious. Yay.  I wish Bluebird and I had a better relationship. I just don't know what I did to hurt it. But she has burned me, time and again, and it's just not worth all the pain to have one good experience every once in awhile.

BMtAXXawpDEOrPQ3GGTWzA.text: Freindliest service in downtown Pittsburgh and beyond no doubt.    Some of the best tasting ciabatta bread, eggs and bacon I have ever eaten.   Prices just right.  Clean and fresh atmosphere.   Great way to refuel and wake up.   Young kid waited on me and was fantastic.  Good didn't take long at all.   I'll be back again and again.    Go there.

wJLUrqJWm9kRhJz2yXH0GQ.text: I've walked by Bluebird Kitchen countless times, always thinking "that looks cute!" but never having a chance to stop in. I recently started a new job and now have a longer lunch break, so a friend from work and I stopped in here for a bite to eat today.   We got there around 1 and the lunch rush was just ending. The line moved quickly, the staff was friendly, and we didn't have to wait long at all while our sandwiches were made.   Speaking of sandwiches--the Cuban that I ordered was fantastic! Rosemary ham, pork belly, a delicious mustard dressing, and (of course) pickles came together in a delicious combination. The ciabatta was sturdy and resisted sogginess during our walk back to the office. Nothing worse than a mushy sandwich!  There were so many delicious pastry items and I wanted to try all of them (it took some serious self control not to pick up a dessert--but Girl Scout Cookies are everywhere my the office right now!). I'll be back some morning for coffee and a pastry.   Overall this was a really pleasant experience and I'm excited to return. Such a great little spot!

D4nEK_UwykZT7FYQa4qs_w.text: It was such a nice sunny day so my friend and I decided to grab lunch. The vibe at bluebird reminds me of home in San Francisco. We decided to split the Cuban and the roast beef sandwiches. Both were delicious, but the roast beef was a little too dry for my taste both in the beef and in the composition of the sandwich. That Cuban tho.... Omg so deliciously moist and flavorful and he pickles were awesome. We also decided to have a rhubarb oat bar while we waited for the sandwiches to be made, and that was bomb too. Overall I'd come back again to try the rest of their menu, especially those breakfast items they have

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cuban in the back, roast beef in he front
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Rhubarb oat bar

Ry2GQ0lKMh51zzwNeCGjyA.text: What a fabulous little spot! Menu changes daily, but you can bet there will be something (or a lot of things here) that you will like!! Came here for breakfast and got a coffee, small corned beef hash, and salmon pastrami which tasted delicious with their homemade pretzel bread as they were out of bagels. Everything tasted so fresh and delicious! Seating was a little tight, but the lines move quickly and they accept credit cards including AmEx! Yay!

1Eo8BWjgJAOelCHFWvrozQ.text: Came for lunch, had the Cuban and a cookie sandwich for dessert (sugar cookie with mango frosting). This place is delicious. The food was incredible, fresh ingredients. Bread was crusty and clearly baked same day. Not sure if it's expensive for Pittsburgh, but I found the price comparable to places in NYC. Would definitely come back...want to try their breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

L2Ikz_3S4oM_WFn_zvPRqw.text: Discovered this little cafe during a business trip. I ordered the chicken salad. House-roasted chicken with pear slices, grilled onion, blue cheese and candied walnuts was delicious.   There is not much seating. It is more of a "to go" place.   My only complaint is that half my lettuce was heart/core of the head of lettuce.   I would recommend for a healthy, delicious lunch.

i45mYCWwRNGd0qQFWHuziQ.text: Very good coffee - Counter Coffee beans, can't go wrong there.  Extremely friendly service, very welcoming.  Had a great breakfast sandwich - fried egg, sausage, on ciabatta bread.  Everything else looked great as well.  Good atmosphere in there as well, nice place to hang out and enjoy your food and coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-qeS1GkKervFXPu-_QxOTw.text: Such a disorganized place. Not worth the amount of time you'll spend waiting on them or the money. Beware that catering orders run far off schedule. It would be advisable to plan for them to arrive 45 minutes to an hour late. They don't care about being late. It seems that they believe you're lucky to be eating their just ok food. Go somewhere else. If I could give zero stars I would.

roLTuoPwgvl7vfu6cahWmg.text: This place has wonderful service and a lovely atmosphere, but I was not so convinced on the food. After being super hyped up by yelp for a wonderful and decadent morning fix, I was a bit let down. We ordered the sweet potato hash, which was definitely the star of the show as compared to all the other items we ordered - it was nicely balanced with salt and sweetness, although the pork . While their pastries are good, their breakfast sandwiches are bread heavy and lacking in generous filling. Definitely a neat spot, but not worth the wait to visit until Monday morning, since this place is so audacious to be closed on weekends. Can't imagine what the owners are thinking with these hours, as this schedule is the anti-thesis of how small businesses survive and thrive. I find this offensive as a loyal consumer in fare of authenticity. I recommend trying a brunch spot with better execution if you're looking for a truly satisfying meal. Not worth the hype.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pretty tasty (but not the best ever) cinnamon bun with bacon topper. Eeeeh, it was ok.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet potato hash! Totally made the trip here worth it.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. PASTRAMI CURED SALMON- HOUSE CURED SALMON, CUCUMBER, CREAM CHEESE, OVEN DRIED TOMATO, HOUSE BAGEL. disappointing, too much bread

b4TZILxRv2WOetgwwg7QQQ.text: I've always loved this place.   When I was a meat eater, I loved their turkey sandwich. It's so fresh, flavorful and delicious! The bacon jam was very savory and the avocado was very creamy. It couldn't be beat!   As a vegetarian, I love that there is always a special every month! I loved their black bean burger on a brioche bun! Super tasty.   I love their baked goods! The peanut butter sandwich, chocolate chip cookie dough sandwich, and vegan chocolate chip cookie are amazing! I mean, all of their baked goods look awesome.   I love their hot teas as well. The coconut oolong is my favorite!

XPmetLvrRsSTmXkjN3EgUw.text: Although they have some good food, I'm not totally sold on it. For my birthday, some friends have ordered me a pistachio cake which was delicious! It was totally unexpected and I really liked it. I would definitely recommend their cake although it's a bit pricey. Other than the cake, I had mixed feelings about their other dishes. For this visit, I got the chicken salad in a croissant. At first, I really liked it as the mix of apples and nuts were so good and made it crunchy. But I was a bit disappointed in the amount of mayo that it had as I don't like too much of it. I also got a side dish which had carrots, veggies and herbs. This was okay as I didn't end up finishing it.  Overall, I think that the food is a bit pricey but they do have some good stuff. In addition, there is limited space for seating during lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken salad croissant

vRaV9vIy32AcPtUfMHKvLQ.text: We really enjoyed our visit to Bluebird. The staff was friendly, and the food was excellent. I got the chicken salad croissant, as well as a couple of cookies for later. The croissant was stellar. We will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KFQLKTNbG3zBbhKgv51Vtg.text: More like 3.5 stars...So I got here at 7 am on a business day. I had a meeting with a colleague and she had thought that this is a bonafide, sit-down place for breakfast (so did I), but we were both proven wrong! The layout of the restaurant is somewhat strange, with not much sitting area except for two bars along the walls. I ordered a pastrami cured salmon, which I was quite happy with. My colleague ordered a frittata and it was somewhat strange that the frittata came in a bread...I had never seen a frittata as a sandwich...while I didn't try frittata, it was obvious that my colleague didn't like her food and actually ordered a second food as I was leaving because she was not happy with the frittata...I also found the ordering process somewhat weird and I think the barristas could have been more helpful. I thought it was obvious that I was a bit lost when I had gone in at 7 ish in the morning and I was one of the few people in the cafe, so it should have been easy to just quickly guide me to where I should order, but that didn't happen...Overall, it was still a positive experience, but not more than 3.5 stars... Hint: they refill coffee for $1.60.

J2TDgM0m_vlhqyK59XmUuQ.text: I had breakfast here two days in a row.  The fried egg sandwich was tasty but a handful to manage (read, ended up all over my hands, shirt, and eventually lap.)  The second try I got the quiche - light, creamy, and stationary!  Coffee was delicious both days.

7tmMAJ_A0lE1qYRIw9skLQ.text: I didn't try any of their food but I got a caramel almond milk latte. I didn't taste any caramel and it didn't taste good at all. I threw it out after a few sips

2YNwrR31d2KKvdMgMyrkkA.text: We came to Pittsburgh for a work meeting, my husband ordered the biscuits and gravy every day for breakfast- he loved them. We wanted a healthier option for breakfast that would keep us full. I ordered the sweet potato hash the first day and the steel cut oats the second day. Both days I had the smoothie with protein added. I couldn't stop talking about the food- it was DELICIOUS. I also got a salad to go for lunch the first day. The blood orange vinaigrette was the best I've ever had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DTURtExE7DEy1grtzp2NBA.text: Bluebird Kitchen is a great little breakfast and lunch spot tucked away alongside Market Square. I am absolutely hooked on their Bluebird Granola, which is a rich Greek yogurt layered with honey and seasonal fruit. It makes a great, filling breakfast. They also have breakfast sandwiches, smoothies, oats and a quiche of the day. For lunch, there are very nice, house made sandwiches, fresh sides, salads and soups. I'm a vegetarian and there is a rotating monthly vegetarian sandwich and salad -- so, even if options are slightly limited, there will always be something for you. Today there was a delicious garden veggie soup that was really chock full of fresh veggies, and it came with a big chunk of bread for about $6. Their pastries are also delicious; I'm partial to the cookie sandwiches with buttercream. The only downside is that it's a small space with only a few counter-style seats available. In summer, no problem as you can take your food outside to Market Square; tougher in winter if you happen to be out and about. Not an issue for me as I generally take my food back to my office, but this makes it a place I don't generally go to eat with someone when the weather is less than ideal.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The absolutely outstanding Bluebird Granola. My favorite thing.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Delicious veggie soup. No skimping on the veggies here!

daF7KOIUKe1fTHJB1ZRrOg.text: I was excited to try this place for lunch after reading the reviews but was underwhelmed with what I ordered. The sweet potato soup was not hearty at all - the broth was basically water with a sweet potato flavor. The turkey sandwich was just OK. I don't think the flavor combination worked. I didn't finish either one.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey sandwich and sweet potato soup. Just OK

ox3mfFM6iCzJTP2PCtJzDQ.text: Delicious, healthy lunch spot in the city. The location on Forbes near Market Square is more of a grab and go. They have tons of premade salads ready to take (made daily). Fresh soups, various sandwiches on fresh breads and baguettes, and premade sides like broccoli quinoa salad or a roasted potato salad. Each mouth they feature a special sandwich and salad as well. All the options are quite healthy and everything is so fresh. Very vegan and vegetarian friendly too. Do not leave without a sweet treat--their vegan chocolate chip cookie is to die for. Friendly staff, prices are kind of high, though. The second location on Stanwix is much bigger inside with tables, however they offer a much smaller menu than the original Forbes location.

photos.caption: Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One of their several rotating salads. Potatoes, kale, farro, served with a honey mustard type dressing. Potato overload.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegan chocolate chip cookie. Wowowow was it divine.
Photo of Bluebird Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Broccoli and quinoa salad - small side

_clLsM4sy3EWAU9Arp88oQ.text: Staying in the downtown area there weren't many options for a quick breakfast all weekend long. Most places were only open during the week, so we only had Friday to find a local breakfast spot. Rolled the dice and went to Bluebird and it paid off.   Nice modern looking place. Clean and sleek. Quick line. Ordered up some biscuits and gravy. While not known as a city that does biscuits and gravy, these were pretty good.   If you're around during the week and looking for a full, yet inexpensive breakfast, Bluebird is your joint.

yJ21cz39Qwe9YbsytCQQPw.text: This place is good. The sweet potato hash was way too greasy though. I don't need a puddle of grease at the bottom of my plate. But overall it was very good. The salmon and cucumber bagel sandwich with sundried tomatoes was great. The bread pudding was great. The cappuccinos were great.

R2u7fN_AYqTiYdyssHSXWQ.text: If you're in market square definitely check out this spot! I got a HOUSE ROASTED CHICKENROASTED AMISH CHICKEN, POINT REYES BLEU CHEESE, ROASTED SHALLOT, SHAVED PEAR, CARAMELIZED WALNUT, BANYULS VINAIGRETTE salad and it was really good. They give you a huge portion of roasted chicken, but I do think there could of been more of the other items listened in the salad. It was super fast and easy to grab the already pre made salad on my lunch break when I wanted a healthy option! It's super clean and cute I would definitely recommend and I will be returning. I thought the customer service was great too, very knowledgeable and kind!

G3cDTMXujeoKelRFHKgstQ.text: I don't work downtown, so most of my experience with Bluebird concerns catering orders. They've catered several meetings for me at various times of the day so I've ordered everything from breakfast pastries/coffee/fruit to boxed lunches and hors d'oeuvres. Each time, the food has been outstanding. You can tell Bluebird doesn't take any shortcuts - their food is of the highest quality and is well presented. In terms of our interactions, Bluebird has been flexible with my guests' dietary restrictions, they're easy to get in touch to discuss the order, and their delivery drivers are timely and communicative.

z7W8UAUbeMtpupzgvycVIQ.text: I want to love Bluebird, but I every time I go in, I end up leaving totally frustrated.  The good:  the quality is good and things always taste good.  The acceptable:  their pricing is a bit on the high side in my opinion ($7+ for an omelette sandwich?).  The bad:  It always takes FOREVER and, while the staff is pleasant, no one seems to care that you're standing there waiting.  This morning, I ordered a frittata (read: omelette) sandwich.  I waited between 10 and 15 minutes for a fried egg sandwich -- not what I ordered nor capable of being eaten as a sandwich with runny yoke all over it by the time I made it back to my office.  As usual, the staff in the kitchen looked like they were having a good time and no one looked particularly concerned about the fact that it took at 3 times longer than it should have.

ReFu-tDv-urzZ6HcnDkfzQ.text: One of my favorite spots to grab a quick breakfast or lunch while I'm working downtown.  The options are endless- changing soups, salads, and sides based on seasonal availability- so you never get tired of the food.  I've never had anything here that I don't like!  A recent favorite is their breakfast fried egg sandwich on pretzel...still drooling over it days later.  Be sure to try their coffee as well!

CQGc-jOlNognn5RnO0UN-A.text: If you're interested in getting soups or sides I suggest calling and asking ahead of time what they have since it changes daily. Their cauliflower soup is the absolute best!! They have a monthly vegetarian sandwich that can often be made vegan and their sides and soups are clearly labeled vegan. They also usually have vegan chocolate chip cookies that are incredible! I haven't had any of their other desserts but they look amazing. Just be aware if you go at peak lunch time it can take a bit to get your sandwich (sides, soups, and desserts are ready right away).

lftQV7qnmHC8447rL9NQyw.text: A place to remember mamas cooking from the good ol' days. Typical southern home breakfast  cookin to remind you of real cookin! Homemade meals, hospitality, and a glimpse of the past that's preserved in the present. A real remembrance of what you hope and pray your grandma or ma's cooking would be like. Very nostalgic!

DHWVpV5UIIeBPre4u5qQyA.text: Overpriced salads that are often soggy!  I don't know what the problem is here, but the salad are always bowls full of half-rotted lettuce and hardly any "fixins."  $10 is too much to pay for this sad veggie option.  The soups are great, and I think it's one of the better cups of coffee in the city.  (Plus, the folks at the Stanwix store are soooo nice and don't have the attitude you find at the Market Square location).  I just wish they'd get it together on the salad front....because the greens are gross.

MmF2BGQhTchI4HCVT-53eg.text: Absolutely fantastic breakfast sandwiches and coffee.  I was there waiting for them to open at 7am while watching (and drooling over) all the fresh baked goods stream out of the kitchen.  I went with a egg and cheese sandwich on the pretzel roll after talking myself out of multiple delicious looking sweets (breakfast bread pudding!?).  The bread was soft, airy, and salty.  The egg was perfectly cooked and loaded with good cheese.  Top this off with a spot on brewed cup of coffee with beans from my favorite roaster from NC (Counter Culture) and I was set.  Wish I was in town long enough to grab another breakfast or try the lunch.  Next time Bluebird.

ZIX40ARjGYTSUDd5zf28mw.text: Food was great walked here from my hotel that was downtown with a co worker and it was Worth the walk! I went in there to get something healthy (quiche) and walked out with some amazing sweets . The women who worked there were super nice but it took a moment to get some service.

7zLiwYF58ElIqTLAWYMQCA.text: Put it this way: I haven't written a Yelp review since 2008. I forgot I was even a member until I tried to join today solely to write about this place.  I've had my eye on Bluebird for a couple months, and thank goodness I finally found an afternoon without a single reason to walk by. There was actually a line spilling onto the sidewalk, but not being in a rush, I was intrigued by the wait rather than discouraged. I'm so glad this place is living up to its hype.  Bluebird Kitchen belongs in New York. No wait, San Francisco. The point is this place totally elevates breakfast & lunch. Its focus on fresh & local, coupled with its relaxed & rustic yet somehow also sophisticated atmosphere & presentation is unexpected in downtown Pittsburgh. It's high time the East End shared some of the foodie wealth! It's refreshing. The prices are fair ($4-$5 breakfast items, $6-$8 sandwiches, $7-9 salads) The staff is adorable & friendly, too.  All I ordered on my first visit was a white bean, sausage & broccoli soup. I was pleasantly surprised to find it was broth-based, rather than a thick, roux base I anticipated with "bean" in the title. I felt like I was at my mom's kitchen table eating this soup, that's how fresh it tasted. I love soup but tend to shy away from eating it in restaurants because it's usually loaded with sodium. This tasted good for me: light yet hearty.   Check out Bluebird, if only for a dessert. I didn't have one but I loved how each cookie looked unique; no pre-mixes here! Enjoy, folks.

8DrCUYZKuaKyAIQmajLM8w.text: Best food I've found in pit. Fresh juice, local eggs and bacon and homemade sausage. They just need wipes.

G1YbbOiYrx6eeMkskjCqXw.text: Stumbled across this little place while looking for a quick place for breakfast on our way out of town.  Unexpectedly, they make the best cheesy grits I've had in the north! Seems like a busy local favorite.

9_dWpluGsggJczE7XMKsJA.text: I picked up a house roast beef for a working lunch. It was quick to be made and definitely carries some weight. The ingredients were fresh to the bite and enough horseradish aioli to delight and not overwhelm my taste buds and the sandwich. I do like adding chips for a side but found that the sandwich alone was enough to satiate my stomach. If you get there early or late enough you can find parking around market square but if you go during peak hours it won't be so easy to get in and get out.

IMLUnZm9vHAQFM4j-prgRw.text: Yinzer Ottolenghi. Rotating menu, everything's high quality.
